alert.note: Alert for Goliad; Inland Refugio; Victoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 21 at 3:30AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Victoria, northeastern Goliad and northeastern Refugio Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 329 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fannin, or 9 miles east of Goliad, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Victoria, McFaddin, Guadalupe, Fannin, Schroeder, Coleto Creek Park, Saxet Lakes and Oak Village. This includes the following highways... US Highway 183 near mile marker 644. US Highway 59 between mile markers 638 and 664. US Highway 77 between mile markers 582 and 600. US Highway 87 near mile marker 818. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for south central Texas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for south central Texas.
